# Windows

This blog helps you to download R and RStudio in Windows or Mac

## R

### Download R 

::: callout-note
-   Go to the [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/) website. 
-   Choose a CRAN mirror and click on Download R for Windows.
-   Click on base and then on Download `R x.x.x` for Windows (the latest version will be shown).
:::

### Install R

::: callout-note
-   Open the downloaded `.exe` file and follow the installation process.
-   Choose the installation language and follow the set-up process.
-   Choose the default options, unless if `user` has any specific requirements and after installation     click `finish`.
:::

## RStudio

### Download RStudio

::: callout-note
-   Go to [RStudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/) website.
-   Choose the `RStudio Desktop` **(Open Source License)** for Windows.
:::

### Install Rstudio

::: callout-note
-   Open the downloaded `.exe` file and follow the installation process.
-   Choose the installation language and follow the set-up process.
-   Choose the default options, unless if `user` has any specific requirements and after installation     click `finish`.
:::

# MacOS

## R

### Download R 

::: callout-note
-   Go to the [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/) website. 
-   Click on Download R for `macOS`.
-   Download the latest `.pkg` version for macOS.
:::

### Install R

::: callout-note
-   Open the `.pkg` file once downloaded.
-   Follow the installation prompts and enter your password when prompted.
-   Click Continue and then Install.
:::

### Install Xcode (for dependencies)

::: callout-tip
-   Open Terminal and run the following command to install Xcode tools:
-   `xcode-select --install`
-   Please follow the instructions on the screen and install.
:::

## RStudio

### Download RStudio

::: callout-note
-   Go to [RStudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/) website.
-   Choose the `RStudio Desktop` **(Open Source License)** for `macOS`.
:::

### Install Rstudio

::: callout-note
-   Open the downloaded `.dmg` file.
-   Drag and drop the `RStudio icon` to the Applications folder.
-   Click and open RStudio from the Applications folder.
:::


#### Notes

::: callout-important
-   `System Requirements:` Both Windows and macOS should be up-to-date to avoid compatibility or any     other issues.
-   `R and RStudio Versions:` Always ensure that you are using the **latest versions** of both R and     RStudio for compatibility with packages.
-   `Package Dependencies:` Some packages might require additional **system libraries**, which the        package installer will prompt you to install if needed.
:::
